title: Projects
text:
Here are some of my key projects that demonstrate my skills in data analytics, machine learning, and cloud computing.






Billboard Chart Analysis


Description: Comprehensive analysis of music industry trends using Billboard Hot 100 data, exploring artist performance patterns, genre evolution, and chart dynamics across multiple decades. Expanded from artist-specific analysis to broader music industry landscape insights.
Technologies Used: Python, Pandas, Matplotlib, Seaborn, NumPy
Key Features: - Time-series analysis of chart performance and artist longevity - Genre trend identification and evolution tracking - Artist performance metrics and comparative analysis - Data visualization of music industry patterns
Outcomes: Identified key trends in music industry evolution and developed insights into factors contributing to chart success. Demonstrated proficiency in data cleaning, exploratory data analysis, and statistical visualization.
Links: GitHub Repository




Description: Led data analysis for comprehensive study examining geographic job market patterns, salary trends, and remote work opportunities comparing AI-focused versus traditional career paths across different US markets.
Technologies Used: Python, SQL, PySpark, AWS, Statistical Modeling
Key Features: - Large-scale job market data processing and cleaning - Salary trend analysis and predictive modeling - Geographic pattern analysis across metropolitan areas - Remote work trend identification
Results: Delivered actionable insights on career opportunities and salary expectations across different markets and career paths. Served as data lead for Group 09‚Äôs comprehensive analysis.
Links: GitHub Repository




Check out my GitHub profile for more projects and ongoing work in data analytics and machine learning.

title: About Me
text:
Hi, I‚Äôm Thomas Primero! üëã
I‚Äôm a 2nd year Master‚Äôs student studying Business Analytics at Boston University, with a passion for data analytics, statistical modeling, and machine learning.

title: About Me
text:
Background
I started my career in finance and operations at Charles Schwab, where I work as an Operations Specialist validating complex payroll and census datasets. While I excelled at ensuring data integrity and automating workflows with Excel and VBA, I found myself increasingly drawn to the why behind the numbers‚Äîwhat patterns existed, what predictions we could make, and how data could drive strategic decisions. This curiosity led me to Boston University‚Äôs Master‚Äôs program in Business Analytics, where I‚Äôve discovered my passion for the investigative side of data science. Through coursework in data mining, machine learning, and statistical modeling, I‚Äôve learned to approach problems systematically: starting with messy, real-world datasets and transforming them into actionable insights through rigorous exploratory analysis and feature engineering.

title: About Me
text:
What I Do
I specialize in:

Data Analytics: Using Python, SQL, and R for data processing and analysis
Machine Learning: Building predictive models and classification algorithms
Data Mining: Feature engineering, exploratory analysis, and uncovering patterns in complex datasets
Data Visualization: Creating interactive dashboards with Plotly and Tableau

title: About Me
text:
Skills
Programming Languages: Python, R, SQL, Java
Technologies: Apache Spark, AWS, GitHub, Quarto, Jupyter
Tools: VS Code, RStudio, Git

title: About Me
text:
Career Goals
I‚Äôm transitioning from operations into data analytics, combining my finance background with advanced analytics training from Boston University‚Äôs Master‚Äôs program. I‚Äôm particularly drawn to data analyst and data scientist roles where I can uncover insights through rigorous research and statistical modeling.
What drives me is the investigative side of analytics; diving deep into messy datasets, asking the right questions during exploratory analysis, and transforming raw data into meaningful patterns. My data mining coursework solidified this passion, teaching me to approach problems systematically: from feature engineering and cleaning to building predictive models that actually tell a story.
My ideal role would leverage both my operational foundation; validating complex datasets, ensuring data integrity, automating workflows and my technical skills in Python, SQL, and machine learning. I‚Äôm especially interested in marketing analytics or research-focused teams where thorough data exploration directly shapes strategic decisions.

title: About Me
text:
Interests
When I‚Äôm not analyzing data, I enjoy:

Being active at the gym/outdoors. I love walking the many trails in Austin, Texas.
Traveling/Exploring new places, foods, and even ideas!
Reading books and learning new things.
